intro: Craibia utilis, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade. Craibia utilis is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
